Currently having this in the test recipes is a no-op so its safe to remove.
Some context - This field was added in one of the initial versions of recipe implementation with the intention that things that are packages will be in the dependencies section, and things like homebrew which are not packages will be under the requires section. This was back when the config still used requires key and not dependencies so everything would ultimately go under the requires key in kernel config. We never got a closure on how to handle this though. There have also been ideas that evergreen vends generic packages for everything such that nothing outside packages needs to be depended on. But no matter what we do about it, we don't use the requires keyword anymore and we can make relevant changes and add tests/test data accordingly when we get to a solution.

nodes.bodyText: instead of sleeping here, if you run a callback on the publish thread then you can be assured that your config change is done with all of its callbacks and perform the verify at that point. But be aware that any assertions you put into the publish thread won't work; you'll need another way of failing the test if they fail, such as a future or countdownlatch.
